intro: Fadogia graminea var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy fadogia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pods that contain seeds, and it is often found in dry, grassy habitats. Its hairy texture, as indicated by the varietal name, is a notable botanical feature.
